in_favor: The establishment of marine protected areas has led to an increase in ocean conservation, with a mean proportion of each marine key biodiversity area covered by protected areas rising to 45.5% in 2023

Sustainable fishing practices are being implemented, as evidenced by the fact that less than 30% of marine key biodiversity areas in some regions are protected, highlighting a critical need for action within the next six years

Ocean conservation efforts are crucial for maintaining ocean health and humanity's well-being, with coral reefs supporting a quarter of marine species and generating trillions of dollars in revenue annually
against: Over 90% of the ocean experienced heatwave conditions at some point during 2023, leading to a fourth global coral bleaching event

The frequency and severity of coral bleaching will likely increase as oceans continue to warm amid rising global temperatures, with up to 99% of corals potentially being lost by 2050 at 2Â°C of warming
Destructive fishing practices and habitat destruction are still prevalent, with less than 30% of marine key biodiversity areas in some regions being protected
